title: American Paintings and Sculpture 53rd Annual and Memorial Exhibition of Paintings and Drawings by Grant Wood
description: This exhibition in the annual American series is of extraordinary importance because it partly served as the memorial retrospective exhibition for Grant Wood, and also because it showcased for the first time Edward Hopper’s Nighthawks, which won the Ada S. Garrett Prize and was acquired, before the exhibition, by the Art Institute.

input: American Paintings and Sculpture 53rd Annual and Memorial Exhibition of Paintings and Drawings by Grant Wood
